content.description:
Researchers examined the impact of adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) on the well-being of young children using data from a representative survey measuring health in children. The findings indicated significant connections between the number of ACEs, such as financial struggles and parental stress, and the number of health and developmental issues in children. A higher number of these early childhood stressors increased the likelihood of problems. The study also indicated that children who expressed affection toward their parents managed these challenges more effectively.

Understanding the Impact of Early Challenges on Child Health and Development
